answerText: hydrogen[10] In the Bohr model, a hydrogen atom is said to be in this state if the electron is in the second or any higher energy orbital. This state is contrasted with the ground state.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 8 | 3 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Series of spectral lines of this element are named after Lyman, Balmer, Paschen, and Brackett.  [10] Name this element whose spectrum was predicted using a model developed by Niels Bohr. The Bohr model did not work for any other elements with more electrons.
